emergency.notes: Use 811 or provincial health lines for non‑emergency health advice where available.

tipping.title: Restaurants
tipping.description: 15–20% before tax is standard at sit‑down restaurants; fast‑casual is optional or small change.

tipping.title: Bars & Cafés
tipping.description: At bars, $1–$2 per drink or 15–20% on the tab; cafés often present tip prompts but it’s optional.

tipping.title: Transport & Services
tipping.description: Taxis/rideshare 10–15%; hair/beauty 15–20%; hotel housekeeping $2–$5 per night.

cultural.title: Politeness & Personal Space
cultural.description: Canadians value please/thank you, holding doors, and giving others space in lines and transit.

cultural.title: Punctuality
cultural.description: Arriving on time for reservations, tours, and tickets is expected; late arrivals may lose spots.

cultural.title: Smoking & Vaping
cultural.description: Banned indoors and within posted distances of entrances/patios; check local signage.

safety.title: Night Safety Basics
safety.description: Downtowns are generally safe, but stay in well‑lit areas, keep valuables out of sight, and use licensed transport.

safety.title: Weather Swing
safety.description: Weather changes fast. Pack layers year‑round; winters require traction footwear and insulated gear.

safety.title: Wildlife & Parks
safety.description: In parks, keep at least 30–100 m from wildlife, never feed animals, and follow local bear/wolf/cougar guidance.

customs.title: Sales Tax
customs.description: Prices exclude GST/HST/PST; expect 5–15% added at checkout depending on province.

customs.title: Drinking in Public
customs.description: Open alcohol is generally restricted; only in licensed venues or designated areas.

customs.title: Shoes Indoors
customs.description: Removing shoes at someone’s home is common; look for a shoe rack by the entrance.

cultural.title: Diverse Neighborhoods = Diverse Food
cultural.description: Explore Little Italy, Greektown, Koreatown, Little India, and Chinatown for authentic eats.

cultural.title: Patio Season
cultural.description: Patios fill quickly on warm days; reservations help, and many spots are first‑come.

tipping.title: Auto‑Gratuity for Groups
tipping.description: Large groups (6–8+) often have 18% auto‑gratuity; check your bill.

safety.title: Entertainment District Weekends
safety.description: Expect crowds and traffic late Fri–Sat. Use main streets and licensed cabs or rideshare.

customs.title: Transit Etiquette
customs.description: On the TTC, let riders exit first and keep backpacks off on crowded trains.

cultural.title: Outdoor Culture
cultural.description: Hiking gear and athleisure are normal everyday wear; many cafés welcome casual dress.

tipping.title: Counter‑Service Prompts
tipping.description: Tip screens appear widely; for counter‑service it’s optional or small (5–10%).

safety.title: Rain‑Ready
safety.description: Carry a light waterproof layer; sidewalks get slick and weather shifts quickly.

customs.title: Cyclist Awareness
customs.description: Tons of bike lanes; check for cyclists when opening car doors and crossing lanes.

language.notes: Begin with 'Bonjour'; most service staff can switch to English after.

cultural.title: Café & Terrace Pace
cultural.description: Lingering is normal; service may feel slower than Toronto — it’s intentional.

tipping.title: Resto Norms
tipping.description: 15–20% is standard; some bistros include service — check the bill for 'service inclus'.

safety.title: Old Montreal Cobblestones
safety.description: Wear sturdy shoes — streets can be slick in rain/snow.

customs.title: SAQ for Wine & Spirits
customs.description: Wine/spirits sold at SAQ stores; beer available at groceries and dépanneurs.

cultural.title: Stampede Spirit
cultural.description: During July Stampede, expect western dress, citywide events, and busy reservations.

tipping.title: Downtown Lunch Rush
tipping.description: Popular steak and brunch spots may add auto‑gratuity for groups — check receipts.

safety.title: Chinook Swings
safety.description: Warm Chinook winds can melt snow, then refreeze — watch ice on sidewalks.

customs.title: Car‑Forward City
customs.description: Transit exists but distances can be large; plan rideshare/designated drivers for nights out.

cultural.title: Museum & Government Hours
cultural.description: Many close earlier than big‑city norms; check hours and security screening rules.

safety.title: Canal Conditions
safety.description: In winter, skate only when the Rideau Canal is officially open; heed red/green flags.

customs.title: Cross‑River Quirks
customs.description: Hopping to Gatineau means different taxes and sometimes language norms (French first).

language.notes: A friendly 'Bonjour' first is appreciated; staff often bilingual in tourist areas.

cultural.title: Historic Core
cultural.description: Old Quebec is compact but hilly; comfy shoes beat heels on cobblestones.

safety.title: Winter Hills
safety.description: Stairs and slopes get icy — use handrails and wear traction in deep winter.

customs.title: Quiet Evenings
customs.description: Outside festival periods, evenings can be calm; book dinner earlier.

cultural.title: Tea Culture
cultural.description: Afternoon tea is a thing; dress smart‑casual and reserve ahead on weekends.

safety.title: Harbour Edges
safety.description: Waterfront walkways lack rails in spots — supervise kids and avoid cycling fast.

customs.title: Whale Watching Etiquette
customs.description: Choose operators that follow distance rules; don’t pressure captains to get closer.

cultural.title: Park Pass
cultural.description: A Parks Canada pass is required for most visits and parking within the park.

tipping.title: Resort Pricing
tipping.description: Tourist restaurants may be pricier; 15–20% still standard for table service.

safety.title: Bear‑Smart
safety.description: Carry bear spray on trails, make noise, hike in groups, and secure scented items.
examples: Keep 100 m from bears, 30 m from elk/deer.

safety.title: Mountain Weather
safety.description: Layers, rain shell, and early starts reduce risk of storms and heat/cold swings.

customs.title: Parking Windows
customs.description: Popular lots (Moraine/Louise) use shuttles or reservations in peak season.

cultural.title: Maritime Pace
cultural.description: Service can feel relaxed; enjoy the waterfront stroll-and-sip vibe.

safety.title: Coastal Weather
safety.description: Fog and wind roll in fast; pack a light windproof layer year‑round.

customs.title: Seafood Freshness
customs.description: Daily catch sells out early at popular spots — go earlier for oysters/lobster rolls.

cultural.title: Festival City
cultural.description: Check festival calendars — events can affect traffic and reservations.

safety.title: Deep Winter Prep
safety.description: Extreme cold possible; cover skin, carry phone battery pack, and limit outdoor exposure.

customs.title: River Valley Trails
customs.description: Share paths with cyclists/runners; keep right and use bells/voice when passing.

cultural.title: Lift Etiquette
cultural.description: Move promptly at load/unload, fill chairs fully, and follow staff guidance.

tipping.title: Ski Services
tipping.description: Tip instructors and guides ~10–15% for lessons and tours.

safety.title: Altitude & Exposure
safety.description: Sun is stronger at elevation; use SPF, lip balm, and hydrate.

customs.title: Après‑Ski
customs.description: Boots and ski wear are accepted in bars; check for ID — strict age verification.

cultural.title: Dark‑Sky Respect
cultural.description: Minimize light at night to protect stargazing; use red lights where possible.

safety.title: Wildlife on Roads
safety.description: Drive cautiously at dawn/dusk; animals commonly cross highways.

customs.title: Trail Conditions
customs.description: Check Parks bulletins for closures, ice, or avalanche advisories before hikes.

cultural.title: Tourist vs. Local Vibes
cultural.description: Clifton Hill is flashy; Niagara‑on‑the‑Lake offers calmer wine‑country charm.

safety.title: Mist & Slick Surfaces
safety.description: Paths near the Falls are wet; wear grippy shoes and protect electronics.

customs.title: Winery Tastings
customs.description: Booking tastings in advance is common on weekends/harvest season.

cultural.title: Midnight Sun & Short Nights
cultural.description: In summer, bring sleep masks; some lodging lacks blackout curtains.

safety.title: Remote Travel
safety.description: Carry spare fuel, warm layers, and satellite comms when leaving towns.

safety.title: Aurora Cold
safety.description: For northern lights, dress in multiple insulated layers and warm boots.

customs.title: Respect for Wildlife & Lands
customs.description: Pack out garbage, keep food secured, and follow local First Nations guidance.

cultural.title: Small‑Town Hospitality
cultural.description: Greet locals and ask for trail/boat tips — communities are welcoming.

safety.title: Coastal Weather Swings
safety.description: Wind and rain shift quickly; waterproof layers and sturdy boots recommended.

customs.title: Boat Tour Timing
customs.description: Western Brook Pond boats sell out; reserve ahead in peak months.

cultural.title: Seasonal Pop‑Up Town
cultural.description: Expect limited dining hours and book tours well ahead in polar bear/beluga seasons.

safety.title: Polar Bear Safety
safety.description: Do not walk outside town limits without a guide; heed local warnings and carry no food.

customs.title: Layering & Gear
customs.description: Insulated boots, windproof outerwear, and hand warmers are essential in late fall/winter.

cultural.title: Celtic Music
cultural.description: Live trad sessions pop up in pubs; ask locals for nightly recommendations.

safety.title: Cabot Trail Driving
safety.description: Roads are winding with lookouts; pull over fully for photos and watch wildlife.

customs.title: Parks Canada Pass
customs.description: Some park areas require day passes — check entry signs.

language.notes: French is primary; simple French greetings help.

cultural.title: Fjord Rhythm
cultural.description: Schedules can follow tides/conditions; confirm cruise times the day before.

safety.title: Cold Water
safety.description: Kayaking without proper gear is risky; use guides and wear PFDs.

customs.title: Wildlife Viewing
customs.description: Maintain distance from marine mammals; drones often restricted.

cultural.title: Historic Sites
cultural.description: Fort Henry and Kingston Pen tours can sell out on weekends; pre‑book.

safety.title: Waterfront Wind
safety.description: Lake winds can be strong — secure hats and loose items on boat tours.

customs.title: Thousand Islands
customs.description: Bring passport if your cruise crosses into U.S. waters (some routes do).

language.notes: French first; 'Bonjour' then English if needed.

cultural.title: Poetry & Culture
cultural.description: Check festival dates; town squares host readings and outdoor events.

safety.title: Winter Streets
safety.description: Sidewalks can be compacted snow; wear traction.

customs.title: Cafés & Boulangeries
customs.description: Self‑service water and counter ordering common; linger respectfully at tables.

language.notes: French is primary; bilingual service common near Ottawa.

cultural.title: Park Proximity
cultural.description: Gatineau Park is minutes away — plan time for lakes and lookouts.

safety.title: Park Road Rules
safety.description: Seasonal closures and bike‑only hours occur — check NCC notices.

customs.title: Different Tax
customs.description: Quebec sales tax differs from Ontario; final totals vary when you cross the bridge.

cultural.title: Oktoberfest Timing
cultural.description: Events span multiple venues; tickets and table reservations go fast.

safety.title: Light Rail Crossings
safety.description: Mind ION tracks when driving and walking; look both ways for quiet trains.

customs.title: Farmers’ Markets
customs.description: St. Jacobs gets busy on weekends — arrive early for best selection.
